citation.article-title: Bifidobacterium gallicum sp. nov. isolated from human feces.

p.s: Description of Bifidobacterium gallicum sp. nov.
Bifidobacterium gallicum(gal'limm. N.L. adj. gallicus, of or belonging to the Gauls, although ethnic relationships to the French remain speculative)
Gram positive.
Short rods with rounded ends, generally 0.7 to 0.9 by 1.5 to 3.0 μm, mostly arranged in pairs or short chains when grown in liquid culture.
Irregular elongations and swellings occur in cells obtained from colony growth.
Spores are not formed.
Nonmotile.
Not flagellated.
Slimy, capsule-like material is excreted in complex media containing meat extract, bacteriological peptone, salts, and fermentable carbohydrates.
Colonies are whitish, opaque, round, and entire and have a soft consistency.
A weak odor of acetic acid is produced in fresh cultures.
The main fermentation product is acetic acid, and its concentration is about 15 times that of L-(+)-lactic acid; in addition, variable amounts of ethanol (and certainly formic acid) are formed.
No D-(-)-lactic acid or gas is produced.
Metabolism is strictly anaerobic.
Obligatory saccharoclastic via the characteristic bifidoshunt.
Optimum growth occurs at 37 to 39°C; no growth occurs below 30°C or at 45°C and above.
Growth occurs in the range of pH 5.0 to 8.0; optimum growth occurs at pH 6.0 to 7.0.
The following carbohydrates are fermented: L-(+)-arabhose, D-(+)-xylose, D-(-)-ribose, D-glucose, D-galactose, D-fructose, sucrose, maltose, dextrin, starch, and glycogen.
Salicin is slowly fermented.

The following carbohydrates are not fermented: D-gluconate, D-(-)-arabinose, L-(-)-xylose, D-(+)-mannose, L-(-)-sorbose, lactose, cellobiose, melibiose, trehalose, raffinose, melezitose, raffinose, D-(-)-mannitol, D-(-)-sorbitol, myo-inositol, glycerol, and L-(+)-rhamnose.
Litmus milk is not changed.
Arginine is not hydrolyzed.
Nitrate is not reduced.
Indole, H2S, lipase, gelatinase, urease, and catalase negative.

The following enzyme activities are present in cell-free extracts: fructose-6-phosphate and xylulose-5-phosphate phosphoketolases; L-(+)-lactate dehydrogenase (NAD dependent and allosterically regulated by fructose 1,6-diphosphate); and transaldolase.
There is no fructose-1,6-diphosphate aldolase activity.

Relative electrophoretic mobilities are as follows: lactate dehydrogenase (RLDH), 1.10 relative to rabbit-iso-I lactate dehydrogenase of muscle; transaldolase (RTA), 1.65 relative to type X transaldolase of yeast.
The type of peptidoglycan is L-Lys-L-Ala-L-Ser (A3α), with some lysine replaced by ornithine to a variable degree.
The cell wall polysaccharide comprises a galactan polymer of unknown structure; minor amounts of rhamnose may be found in addition to galactose after growth on less complex media.
The G+C content of the DNA is 61 mol% (thermal denaturation method).
The levels of DNA-DNA relatedness to other bifidobacteria range from 8 to 25%.
Habitat: not known.
Only one strain has been isolated from human feces.
The type strain is strain DSM 20093 (= P6).
